provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.--(I) The examination and testing of a metropolitan service vehicle for
the issue of a certificate of fitness shall be canied out by an inspector who,
upon being satisfied that the vehicle complies with the provisions of these
Regulations and of Part II and Part IV of the Road Traffic Regulation$
 1938, (except such of the provisions of those Parts of those Regulations as
have been expressed not to apply to such vehicles by any order made
by the Board under subsection (2) of section 10 of the Act) shall issue a
certificate of fitness in respect of the said vehicle in Form A of the
Schedule.
          (2) Every certificate of fitness as aforesaid shall, without pre-
judice to the power of the Board at any time to revoke it, remain in force for
such period, k i n g not more than two years fmm the date of issue thereof, as
 may be stated in such ceficate of fitness.
        (3) A person driving a metropolitan senice vehicle on a mad shall
produce the certificate of fitness mentioned in these Regulations when
required so to do by any police constable or by any inspenor.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. A conductor's badge designed in accordance with the panan set out
in Form2'F of the Schedule to the Road Tr&c Regulatiom, 1938, shall be
issued by the Board to each licensed conductor on payment of a fee of
twenty-five cents, and the Board shall enter in a register kept for the purpose
the number of each badge so issued.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-41) Every licensed conductor shall wear the badge issued to him in Znd
accordance with regulation 13 whilst he is engaged on a metropolitan service %

          (2) Every such badge shall be worn and displayed in a conspicuous
manner on the front left side of the coat or tunic of the conductor in such a
way as to be readily visible to persons travelling or proposing to travel on the
vehicle in question

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. In the event of the loss of a conductor's badge the conductor in
question shall immediately notify the Board of such loss and shall on
production of his licence and on payment of a fee of twenty-five cents be
entitled to receive a new badge and the Board shall endorse on his licence the
number of the new badge issued and shall record the same in the register kept
for the purpose.

provisions.title: Section 16
provisions.content:
16. Where the licence of a conductor is suspended or revoked the
conductor in question shall immediately surrender his licence and his badge
to the Board

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. A badge issued to a conductor under these Regulations shall not be
transferable.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. No person shall act as a,conductor of a metropolitan service vehicle
or hold himself out to be such a conductor or wear any conductor's badge
issued in accordance with these Regulations unless he is the holder of a valid
conductor's licence issued in accordance with these Regulations.

provisions.title: Section 19
provisions.content:
19.--(I) Every licensed conductor and driver shall wear a uniform
whilst he is engaged on a metropolitan senice vehicle in discharging his
duties as a driver or conductor, as the case may be.
         (2) The uniform spenfied in paragraph (I) shall be-
       (a) in the case of a male driver, a pair of dark blue pants worn
             with a light blue shim;
       (b) in the case of a female driver, a pair of dark blue pants or a dark
           blue skirt worn with a Light blue blouse;
       (c)   in the case of a male conductor, a pair of dark blue pants worn
             with a light grey s m
       (d)   in the case of a female conductor, a pair of dark blue pants or
             dark blue skirt worn with a light grey blouse.
         (3) Each driver shall wear the prescribed epaulets on both shoulders
of the uniform
          (4) Every licensed conductor and driver shall wear,on the pocket of
the shirt or blouse, the logo of the lioensee to whom the conductor and driver
are employed.
